data.title: Unit Design System
data.tagline: One unit. One ratio. Everything scales.
data.problem: Design systems have arbitrary token values that don't relate to each other. Scaling UI density requires changing dozens of variables.
data.solution: Two CSS variables control everything: --unit (base size) and --ratio (growth rate). All tokens derive from a modular scale. Change one value, entire UI scales proportionally.
philosophy: One unit to rule them all: every size derives from --unit Ã— --ratio^n
Element-first: style native HTML elements, not wrapper components
Mathematical harmony: modular scale creates visual consistency
Density modes: change --unit for compact/standard/spacious UI
Fluid scaling: use clamp() for responsive UI without breakpoints
Progressive enhancement: CSS works alone, JS adds interactivity
